result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Kiss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J. Kiss

records.addlTxt: Denying Further Stay of Jail Sentence
Letter to Judge re: report date

2:06 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael J. Kiss in court. Calling 21CM246 & 22CM19. Court review of case. Pfeifer states spoke with Defendant - waiting to see if Defendant obtained counsel - waiver of counsel was taken - Defendant did not contact DA's office. Defendant states tried to get a loan for counsel - not able to due so -was ill -started back to work - would like to contact DA's office. Bond continued. adj. 02:10 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michael J. Kiss appeared in court. Calling 21CM246 & 22CM19. Court review of case - defendant not eligible for PD/court appointed counsel. Schiek states Defendant has met with ADA. Defendant would like to waive right to counsel. Court reads on waiver of counsel. Court enters not guilty pleas and will set for pretrial. Defendant to make appointment with ADA. Bond continued. adj. 03:27 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:56 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michael J. Kiss appeared in court. Calling 21CM246 & 22CM19. Court review of case - not eligible for court appointed counsel. Defendant would like more time to obtain counsel. Bond continued. adj. 02:56 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
on Petition for Appointment of an attorney - DENIED

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
3:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michael J. Kiss appeared in court. Calling 21CM246 & 22CM19. Court review of case. Court questions Defendant on counsel. Court will set out. Defendant will apply for Court appointed counsel. Bond continued. adj. 03:07 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:55 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michael J. Kiss appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Defendant states does not qualify for PD - will apply for Court appointed counsel. Court questions Defendant on residence. Pfeifer statement to bail. Court questions Defendant on employment. Court sets bond. adj. 01:57 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
